item.title: Streetcar project construction threatens Automobile Alley merchants
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Gary Goldman stepped onto the patio of his Cultivar Mexican Kitchen restaurant, pulled out his cell phone and started frantically texting. Streetcar line construction vehicles had collected in front of the building on N. Broadway Ave blocking parking and the view of his restaurant at the beginning of lunchtime Thursday. His lunch customers are what’s […]

The post Streetcar project construction threatens Automobile Alley merchants appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Streetcar open house draws crowd on nice day – Gallery
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The only thing that went wrong for EMBARK staff at the streetcar open house Friday downtown was that they brought only 300 t-shirts when well over 500 came by. It was a beautiful day and a line had already formed down the street by 11 a.m. when they opened. Here is our gallery of sights […]

The post Streetcar open house draws crowd on nice day – Gallery appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Streetcar update – First car, first loop nearing completion
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The first streetcar is scheduled for delivery in January and the first loop for the streetcar system is scheduled for March 2018 if plans proceed as expected. Wednesday, the Transit/modern streetcar subcommittee of the MAPS 3 Citizens Advisory Board heard reports from representatives of the firm contracted to install and operate the streetcar system and […]

The post Streetcar update – First car, first loop nearing completion appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Will OKC streetcars get stuck in traffic?
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Will the new streetcars in downtown Oklahoma City end up in traffic snarls just like a car would? It’s a question several readers recently asked us. Those closest to integrating streetcars with the rest of OKC traffic say they are working to make that a minimal concern. After decades of development, and then beefing up […]

The post Will OKC streetcars get stuck in traffic? appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKC Council modifies panhandling ord, prepares to end color events
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Also hears reports about Streetcar and Draper Lake Trails progress The City of Oklahoma City Council voted unanimously to modify the controversial panhandling ordinance passed December 2015. The changed ordinance allows for activities such as collecting money on medians if the speed limit on the street where the activity is taking place is below 40 […]

The post OKC Council modifies panhandling ord, prepares to end color events appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: MAPS 3 streetcar line work begins
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Tuesday a crowd larger than usual for a groundbreaking attended the start of construction for the MAPS 3 streetcar track line for Oklahoma City. Enjoying the good fortune of a sunny day with temperatures in the 70s, city officials, staff, supporters and the curious came to a spot near the railroad tracks and East Sheridan […]

The post MAPS 3 streetcar line work begins appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
